[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Struct: Address] [Memory leak] Does the Copy implementation properly handle memory, or can repeated copying of Address values in hot API paths cause memory fragmentation or leaks that degrade performance over time? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: FromStr::from_str()] [Stack overflow] Can recursive or deeply nested parsing logic in AccountAddress::from_str() cause stack overflow when processing extremely complex or malformed address strings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: Serialize::serialize()] [Temporary allocation] Does the to_string() call in Serialize allocate temporary strings that could accumulate in bulk serialization operations, causing memory pressure or OOM conditions during high-traffic periods? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Struct: Address] [Address derivation] If Address is used in key derivation or signature schemes, can the Copy semantics allow addresses to be duplicated in ways that weaken cryptographic security or enable key reuse attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: Hash implementation] [Collision resistance] Does the Hash trait implementation have cryptographic collision resistance, or can attackers find address collisions that map to the same hash, enabling signature replay or authorization bypasses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: Eq implementation] [Timing attack] Does the equality comparison run in constant time, or can timing differences reveal information about address prefixes or structure that aids in address grinding or brute force attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: Serialize/Deserialize] [Round-trip integrity] Can an Address be serialized and deserialized multiple times without loss of information, or do edge cases exist where round-tripping produces different results, breaking API idempotency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: FromStr + Display] [Inverse relationship] Are FromStr and Display proper inverses, or can some addresses be displayed in a format that cannot be parsed back, creating unrecoverable address representations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: to_standard_string()] [Determinism] Is to_standard_string() guaranteed to be deterministic across all platforms, architectures, and library versions, or can subtle differences cause the same Address to have different standard representations on different nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Struct: Address] [Invariant validation] Are there internal invariants that must hold for Address to be valid, and if so, are they enforced in all construction paths (FromStr, From conversions, deserialization)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: inner()] [Mutability escape] Does inner() returning a reference allow callers to create mutable aliases through unsafe code, potentially violating Address invariants or causing memory corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: Debug::fmt()] [Information disclosure] Does the Debug implementation expose sensitive information about internal Address structure that could aid attackers in reverse engineering address generation or validation logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: Display::fmt()] [Log injection] Can addresses with special formatting be logged in ways that corrupt log files, inject false log entries, or exploit log parsing tools? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: FromStr::from_str()] [Algorithmic complexity] Does address parsing have linear time complexity, or can specially crafted inputs cause quadratic or exponential parsing time, enabling ReDoS-style attacks on the API? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: Serialize::serialize()] [Serialization bomb] Can bulk serialization of Address values in large API responses cause CPU or memory exhaustion, especially if to_string() performs expensive operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Function: to_standard_string()] [Format conversion cost] Is the conversion to standard string format expensive, and can attackers trigger this conversion repeatedly to cause CPU exhaustion in hot API paths? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Tests: test_from_and_to_string()] [Insufficient coverage] The test only checks valid addresses '0x1', '0x001', '0x00000000000000000000000000000001' and some invalid formats - are there edge cases like maximum length, special characters, or Unicode that are not tested and could harbor vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Tests: test_from_and_to_json()] [JSON attack vectors] The test only validates a single address '0x1' - are there untested JSON attack vectors like deeply nested objects, extremely long strings, or numeric representations that could bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/address.rs] [Tests: Missing] [Race condition testing] Are there no concurrency tests to verify Address behaves correctly when accessed from multiple threads simultaneously in the API server? (Medium)
